summary: This document is a sign-in log and training presentation for a Suicide Prevention/SHU Training course held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on December 7, 2018. The presentation outlines Bureau of Prisons (BOP) policies and procedures for preventing inmate suicides, with a focus on Special Housing Units (SHUs), high-risk inmates, and emergency response protocols.

events.title: Suicide Prevention/SHU Training at MCC New York
events.description: A training course was conducted for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on suicide prevention, specifically for inmates in Special Housing Units (SHUs). The training covered risk factors, management strategies for high-risk inmates (mentally ill, behavior disordered, sex offenders, protective custody), and emergency response procedures.

keyFacts: A suicide prevention training was held at MCC New York on December 7, 2018, specifically for staff managing Special Housing Units (SHUs).
The training states that 30-80% of inmate suicides in the BOP occur on locked units like SHUs, and single cells in these units are especially risky.
High-risk inmate groups identified include the mentally ill, behaviorally disordered inmates, sex offenders, and protective custody inmates.
The training recommends double-celling SHU inmates to reduce isolation and suicide risk, unless there is a compelling reason not to.
The document references a 'Psychology Advisory List' (also called PSY Alert) to identify inmates with mental health conditions who may become dangerous or suicidal when placed in the SHU.
